TITLE: TYPO3 Exception Documentation Template in RST
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a template structure for documenting TYPO3 exceptions. It includes sections for version information, installation overview, issue description, and solution steps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1468363946.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
..
   TYPO3 [version] - [date of report]
   ==================================

   Installation Overview
   ---------------------

   Provide as much information about your installation of TYPO3
   including its version number and any other information that
   you think will be relevant to other users who encounter the same issue.

   The Issue
   ---------

   Detail each of the steps or changes that took place leading up to the
   issue occurring.

   Solution
   --------

   Did you resolve the issue? List the steps or changes made that resolved the
   issue.
```

TITLE: Implementing ObjectStorage Relationship in TYPO3 Model
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive example of implementing an ObjectStorage relationship in a TYPO3 model class, including initialization, add/remove methods, and getter/setter methods. Shows how to handle multiple related objects using ObjectStorage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1234386924.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
/**
 * member
 *
 * @var \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Persistence\ObjectStorage<\Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Member>
 */
protected $member = NULL;

/**
 * __construct
 */
public function __construct() {
    //Do not remove the next line: It would break the functionality
    $this->initStorageObjects();
}

/**
 * Initializes all ObjectStorage properties
 * Do not modify this method!
 * It will be rewritten on each save in the extension builder
 * You may modify the constructor of this class instead
 *
 * @return void
 */
protected function initStorageObjects() {
    $this->member = new \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Persistence\ObjectStorage();
}

/**
 * Adds a member
 *
 * @param \Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Member $member
 * @return void
 */
public function addMember(\Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Member $member) {
    $this->member->attach($member);
}

/**
 * Removes a member
 *
 * @param $memberToRemove The member to be removed
 * @return void
 */
public function removeMember(\Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Member $memberToRemove) {
    $this->member->detach($memberToRemove);
}

/**
 * Returns the member
 *
 * @return \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Persistence\ObjectStorage<\Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Member> $member
 */
public function getMember() {
    return $this->member;
}

/**
 * Sets the member
 *
 * @param \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Persistence\ObjectStorage<\Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Member> $member
 * @return void
 */
public function setMember(\TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Persistence\ObjectStorage $member) {
    $this->member = $member;
}
```

TITLE: Updating Retrieved Objects with Repository in TYPO3 (PHP)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a solution for updating objects retrieved from the property mapper by using the repository's 'findByUid()' method, stressing the need for the repository's awareness of the object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1249479819.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
function yourAction(\Some\Model $item)\n{\n    $updateItem = $this->itemRepository->findByUid($item->getUid());\n    /**\n     *  something with $updateItem ...\n     */\n    $this->itemRepository->update($updateItem);\n}
```

TITLE: Configuring Dependency Injection in TYPO3 using YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet demonstrates the necessary configuration for enabling dependency injection in TYPO3. The `autoconfigure` attribute must be set to true either for specific classes or globally with `_defaults`. It requires TYPO3's configuration setup where the Services.yaml file is located.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1476107941.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  _defaults:
    # ...
    autoconfigure: true
    # ...

# ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Correct Plugin Configuration in TYPO3 (PHP)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates the correct way to configure a plugin in TYPO3 using ExtensionUtility::configurePlugin(). It properly specifies the extension name, plugin name, and controller actions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1187176358.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
\TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Utility\ExtensionUtility::configurePlugin(
    'FooExt',
    'PluginName',
    [\Foo\Ext\Controller\PluginController::class => 'show'],
    [\Foo\Ext\Controller\PluginController::class => 'show'] // non-cacheable actions
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Composer Autoload Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure autoloading for a TYPO3 extension using Composer.  It sets up the PSR-4 autoloading standard. This snippet demonstrates how to configure the composer.json file to handle class loading for TYPO3 extensions, which is particularly important in composer-based installations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1289386765.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "name": "my-vendor/my-typo3-cms-distribution",
  "require": {
    "typo3/cms": "7.x-dev"
  },
  "autoload": {
    "psr-4": {
      "MyVendor\\MySitePackage\\": "typo3conf/ext/my_site_package/Classes"
    }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Handling RuntimeException for Missing Getter Method in TYPO3 Model - PHP
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates a RuntimeException that occurs when trying to access a property within a TYPO3 model that either lacks a public visibility, or an associated getter method. It describes the issue with accessing 'cart' property and suggests adding a default value to the property to avoid the error.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1546632293.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
// Situation
// When validating a controller's argument, the following exception is thrown:

#1546632293 RuntimeException Could not get value of property "Site\Site\Domain\Model\Order::cart",
make sure the property is either public or has a getter getCart(), a hasser hasCart() or an isser isCart().

// Solution
// In Model, the property is nullable:
protected ?Cart $cart;

// Add explicitly a default value:
protected ?Cart $cart = null;
```

TITLE: Adding tt_content TypoScript for Plugin Rendering
DESCRIPTION: This TypoScript snippet demonstrates how to add the necessary TypoScript for rendering the `tt_content` list type, specifically for a plugin.  It maps the plugin's controller action to a TypoScript path, enabling TYPO3 to render the plugin within a content element. This ensures that the plugin's output is displayed correctly on the frontend.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1540246570.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
    "tt_content.list.20 {
        tx_myextension_controllers_action = < plugin.tx_myextension.controller.action
    }"
```

TITLE: Configuring Error Display in TYPO3 localconf.php
DESCRIPTION: PHP configuration for localconf.php that sets up error display settings to help debug the array_merge_recursive_overrule() error. This includes setting the displayErrors mode, specifying developer IP addresses, and configuring error handlers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
$TYPO3_CONF_VARS['SYS']['displayErrors'] = '2';
$TYPO3_CONF_VARS['SYS']['devIPmask'] = '123.456.789.123';
//$TYPO3_CONF_VARS['SYS']['devIPmask'] = '*';
$TYPO3_CONF_VARS['SYS']['errorHandler'] = 't3lib_error_ErrorHandler';
$TYPO3_CONF_VARS['SYS']['systemLogLevel'] = '2';
```

TITLE: Configuring Extbase Plugin with ExtensionUtility in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This PHP snippet demonstrates how to configure an Extbase plugin using the ExtensionUtility class. It registers the controller and allowed actions for the plugin. This configuration is essential for defining which actions can be executed by the plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1313855175.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
"\TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Utility\ExtensionUtility::configurePlugin(
       '<ExtensionName>,
       '<PluginName>,
       [
           \Vendor\ExtensionName\Controller\YourController::class => 'yourAction',
       ],
       // non-cacheable actions
       [

       ]
   );"
```

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
'config_type' => array (
    'label' => 'LLL:EXT:my_extension/locallang_db.xml:the_table_name.the_field_name_type',
    'config' => array (
        'type' => 'select',
        'renderType' => 'selectSingle',
        'items' => array (
            array(, )
        ),
        'default' => ,
        'authMode' => $GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['BE']['explicitADmode'],
    )
),
```

TITLE: Implementing Single Object Relationship in TYPO3 Model
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to properly implement a single object relationship in a TYPO3 model class with getter and setter methods. Shows the correct way to define a property with proper annotations and type hints.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1234386924.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
/**
 * contact
 *
 * @var \Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Contact
 */
protected $contact = NULL;


/**
 * Returns the contact
 *
 * @return \Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Contact $contact
 */
public function getContact() {
    return $this->contact;
}

/**
 * Sets the contact
 *
 * @param \Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Contact $contact
 * @return void
 */
public function setContact(\Vendor\Extension\Domain\Model\Contact $contact) {
    $this->contact = $contact;
}
```

TITLE: TYPO3 Corrected Slot Method Example
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides the corrected version of the slot method that returns an array containing `$csvRow`. This aligns the return signature with the original argument structure passed to the signal, preventing exception 1376683066.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1376683066.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
   class DatabaseRecordListSlots
   {
     public function addValuesToCsvRow($csvRow)
     {
       $csvRow['new'] = 128;
       return [$csvRow];
     }
   }
```

TITLE: Setting Request for StandaloneView in TYPO3 Email Sending
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to set the request object for a StandaloneView when sending an email in TYPO3. It uses the internal setRequest method to resolve the RuntimeException related to the f:link.action ViewHelper.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1690365240.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
use TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Mvc\RequestInterface;

public function sendEmail(RequestInterface $request, ...): bool
{
    $this->standaloneView->setRequest($request);
    // Set sender to default value
}
```

     }
 },

TITLE: Defining a PAGE in TypoScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define a basic PAGE object in TypoScript, which is necessary to prevent the 'No page configured for type=0' error. Ensure that this line is present in your TypoScript setup to avoid issues related to missing page configurations.

LANGUAGE: typoscript

```

DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates incorrect usage of array syntax within Fluid templates, causing potential errors related to argument types. The example uses `<f:render>` to render a section with arguments, showing an issue where `someVariable` isn't correctly formatted as a variable reference.

TITLE: Adding Required Types Array to TCA Configuration in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to add the required 'types' array to a TYPO3 TCA configuration file to resolve Exception 1438185331. The example demonstrates adding a minimal 'types' array with key '0', which can be expanded based on specific requirements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1438185331.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
$result = [
   'ctrl' => [
      'title' => 'LLL:EXT:your_extension_key/locallang_db.xml:myfirsttable_mm_second',
      // ...
      'columns' => [
         // ...
      ],
   'types' => [
      '0' => [
        'showitem' =>
      ]
   ],
],
```

TITLE: Configuring TYPO3 Storage with filefill Extension in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures TYPO3’s global extension settings for the filefill extension. It sets up an associative array for storages, defining settings for 'placeholder' and 'identifier' with their respective configurations. This is crucial when encountering compatibility issues with older versions of filefill, as it allows proper setup for TYPO3 using the extension.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1519788775.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
$GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['EXTCONF']['filefill']['storages'][1] = [
         'placeholder' => true,
         [
             'identifier' => 'domain',
             'configuration' => 'https://www.example.de/',
         ],
         [
             'identifier' => 'placeholder',
         ]
   ];
```

DESCRIPTION: Sets the default root page ID for RealURL configuration in TYPO3. This configuration is necessary to prevent the 'ID was outside the domain' error.

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
$TYPO3_CONF_VARS['EXTCONF']['realurl']['_DEFAULT']['pagePath']['rootpage_id'] = 1;
```

TITLE: Correcting Type Hint in Model Setter Method
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates fixing a type hint issue in a model setter method by replacing an incorrect Boolean type with the native bool type
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1278450972.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```

public function setFreeShipping(\Boolean $freeShipping)

// Corrected type hint
public function setFreeShipping(bool $freeShipping)
```

TITLE: Bash MySQL Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This Bash snippet demonstrates how to modify the MySQL configuration file (`my.conf`) to adjust the SQL mode. It shows how to remove certain modes that might be causing compatibility issues. This allows to modify the strictness level of SQL operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1247602160.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
"   > [mysqld]\n   > sql_mode=NO_ZERO_IN_DATE,NO_ZERO_DATE,ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO,NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION"
```

TITLE: TYPO3 Exception Code Snippet
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the structure of the InvalidPasswordHashException in TYPO3. It indicates the exception number and the class name. This exception arises when the TYPO3 system cannot find a handler for a specific password hash algorithm, which typically occurs due to unsupported hashing mechanisms on the server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1533818591.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: TYPO3
CODE:
```
"#1533818591 TYPO3\CMS\Core\Crypto\PasswordHashing\InvalidPasswordHashException
No implementation found that handles given hash. This happens if the
stored hash uses a mechanism not supported by current server."
```

TITLE: Configuring Standalone View Outside Controllers in TYPO3 10+
DESCRIPTION: This PHP code shows how to configure a standalone Fluid view when used outside of controllers by filling default paths with the extension key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1225709595.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
$standaloneView = GeneralUtility::makeInstance(StandaloneView::class);

$standaloneView->getTemplatePaths()->fillDefaultsByPackageName('myextension');

$standaloneView->setTemplatePathAndFilename('EXT:myextention/Resources/Private/Templates/'
. $this->template); ...

TITLE: Deleting Inconsistent File References in TYPO3 with SQL
DESCRIPTION: This SQL snippet addresses issues where file references exist without corresponding file entries in the 'sys_file' table. It deletes such inconsistent records from 'sys_file_reference' and 'sys_file_processedfile'. Requires access to TYPO3's database and permissions to execute DELETE and TRUNCATE operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1317178604.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: SQL
CODE:
```
delete from sys_file_reference where uid_local not in (select uid from sys_file); truncate sys_file_processedfile;
```

TITLE: Correct MenuProcessor stdWrap Configuration in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the correct way to configure `stdWrap` for a TYPO3 MenuProcessor within a FLUIDTEMPLATE.  The `stdWrap.wrap` is moved outside of the `dataProcessing` block, directly under the `lib.myNavigation` definition, resolving the exception.  This ensures proper menu wrapping without configuration errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1478806566.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
lib.myNavigation = FLUIDTEMPLATE
lib.myNavigation {
    file = assets/Resources/Private/Partials/MyNavigation.html
    dataProcessing {
        10 = TYPO3\CMS\Frontend\DataProcessing\MenuProcessor
        10 {
          special = directory
          special.value = 9999
          titleField = nav_title // title
          expandAll = 1
          levels = 3
          as = dropdownNav
        }
    }
    stdWrap.wrap =  <div > | </div>
}
```

TITLE: Initializing Object (Correct)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates the correct way of initializing the query settings, which resolves the "Missing storage page ids" exception. It uses `$this->createQuery()->getQuerySettings()` to create the query settings object, which inherits the plugin context and pid settings from FlexForm or TypoScript. This ensures that the query operates within the correct storage context.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1365779762.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
      public function initializeObject()
      {
          /** @var \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Persistence\Generic\TYPO3QuerySettings $querySettings */
          $querySettings = $this->createQuery()->getQuerySettings();
          $querySettings->setIgnoreEnableFields(true);
          $querySettings->setEnableFieldsToBeIgnored(['fe_group']);
          $this->setDefaultQuerySettings($querySettings);
      }
```

TITLE: Fluidcontent Property Access Error
DESCRIPTION: This snippet highlights an error related to the property 'options.Fluidcontent.sorting' that is not accessible due to changes in Fluid's sorting implementation. Developers are advised to update their extension and change their configuration to utilize the new global sorting options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1263391473.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
> The property "options.Fluidcontent.sorting" on the subject was not accessible.
   > Form now supports sorting as a global option that can be used by any implementation; previously fluidcontent added its own but can now delegate this to Flux. This means that from now on you should define options="{sorting: 10}" instead of wrapping the sorting value in a scope like {Fluidcontent: {sorting: 10}}.
```

TITLE: Incorrect MenuProcessor stdWrap Configuration in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates an incorrect configuration of the TYPO3 MenuProcessor where `stdWrap.wrap` is placed directly within the MenuProcessor's configuration. This will cause exception 1478806566. The correct approach is to move `stdWrap` outside the MenuProcessor's dataProcessing block.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1478806566.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
lib.myNavigation = FLUIDTEMPLATE
lib.myNavigation {
    file = assets/Resources/Private/Partials/MyNavigation.html
    dataProcessing {
        10 = TYPO3\CMS\Frontend\DataProcessing\MenuProcessor
        10 {
          special = directory
          special.value = 9999
          titleField = nav_title // title
          expandAll = 1
          levels = 3
          as = dropdownNav
          stdWrap.wrap =  <div > | </div>
        }
    }
}
```

TITLE: Handling TypoScript Setup Check in TYPO3 Frontend Middleware
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates proper handling of TypoScript setup array access in a TYPO3 Frontend middleware. The code checks if setup is available using hasSetup() before attempting to access the setup array to prevent RuntimeException 1666513645.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1666513645.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
public function process(ServerRequestInterface $request, RequestHandlerInterface $handler): ResponseInterface
{
   $tsfe = $this->getTypoScriptFrontendController();
   $frontendTypoScript = $request->getAttribute('frontend.typoscript');
   if ($frontendTypoScript->hasSetup()) {
       $typoScriptSetupArray = $frontendTypoScript->getSetupArray();
       // ...
   }
}

/**
 * @return TypoScriptFrontendController
 */
 protected function getTypoScriptFrontendController(): TypoScriptFrontendController
 {
    return $GLOBALS['TSFE'];
 }
```

TITLE: Enabling Default Action in TypoScript (TYPO3)
DESCRIPTION: This TypoScript snippet enables the default action to be called if the requested action cannot be resolved. This is useful as an alternative to adding missing controllers to the `ext_localconf.php` file. It allows the default controller action to be executed when a specific action is not found.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1313855173.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
"plugin.your_extension.mvc.callDefaultActionIfActionCantBeResolved = 1"
```

TITLE: Documenting Incorrect TypoScript Syntax - TypoScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an example of incorrect and correct TypoScript syntax regarding line breaks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1507645445.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
.. code-block::typoscript

    # cat=basic/enable/020; type=boolean; label=Activate the feature:
    Enables the feature
    feature = 0
```

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
.. code-block::typoscript

    # cat=basic/enable/020; type=boolean; label=Activate the feature: Enables the feature
    feature = 0
```

TITLE: Integrating Backend Hook in TYPO3 PHP
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use a global hook in the TYPO3 configuration array to add additional backend items. Ensure the filepath provided is valid within the server. This is applicable to older versions of TYPO3 systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1312140064.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
$GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['typo3/backend.php']['additionalBackendItems'][] = filepath
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Controller Context for Standalone View in TYPO3 10+
DESCRIPTION: This PHP snippet demonstrates how to set the controller context for a standalone Fluid view to resolve template loading issues in TYPO3 10 and later versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1225709595.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
$standaloneView = GeneralUtility::makeInstance(StandaloneView::class);

$standaloneView->setControllerContext($this->controllerContext);

$standaloneView->setTemplatePathAndFilename('EXT:myextension/Resources/Private/Templates/'
. $this->template);

$standaloneView->assignMultiple($this->settings);
```

LANGUAGE: plaintext

```

TITLE: Registering Extbase Plugin (Correct)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the correct way to register an Extbase plugin with the vendor name prefix. This shows how to properly register a plugin to prevent class loading issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1289386765.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
// Right
\TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Utility\ExtensionUtility::registerPlugin(
    'MyVendorName.' . $_EXTKEY,
    'Plugin',
    'PluginTitle',
);
```

TITLE: MySQL: Update User Password
DESCRIPTION: This SQL command updates the password for a specified user in the MySQL database. Replace 'db-username' with the actual username and 'password' with the new password. It is crucial when upgrading PHP versions and encountering authentication issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1270853884.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
"update mysql.user set password=PASSWORD('password') where user='db-username'"
```

TITLE: Configuring Template File Path in TypoScript
DESCRIPTION: This TypoScript code configures the template file path using a CASE object. It demonstrates how the backend layout is used to determine the template file, which can lead to the 'Template could not be found' error if the path is incorrect.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1288087061.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
page.10.file.stdWrap.cObject = CASE
page.10.file.stdWrap.cObject {
    key.data = levelfield:-1, backend_layout_next_level, slide
    key.override.field = backend_layout

    default = TEXT
    default.value = fileadmin/templates/RS1.html
}
```

TITLE: Defining Controller Configuration in TYPO3 using PHP
DESCRIPTION: This PHP snippet corrects the deprecated way of configuring plugins in TYPO3 by using fully qualified class names for controller actions. The change affects how `configurePlugin` or `registerModule` are used, ensuring the correct class object is instantiated by TYPO3.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1476107941.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
\TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Utility\ExtensionUtility::configurePlugin(
    'Examples', // $extensionName
    'HtmlParser', // plugin name
    // controller class name => action name
    [\T3docs\Examples\Controller\HtmlParserController::class => 'search',],
    [\T3docs\Examples\Controller\HtmlParserController::class => 'search',]
);
```

It is necessary for developers to understand this exception to effectively manage their TYPO3 setups. The exception message provides context for the issue, including a warning about the setting of [BE][adminOnly].

LANGUAGE: php

```

TITLE: TypoScript Mapping Backend User
DESCRIPTION: This TypoScript code defines the mapping for the `BackendUser` and `BackendUserGroup` models to their respective database tables (`be_users` and `be_groups`). It also includes column mappings, which associate model properties with database columns. This ensures that data is correctly retrieved and stored.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1247602160.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
"   config.tx_extbase.persistence.classes {\n       TYPO3\CMS\Beuser\Domain\Model\BackendUser {\n           mapping {\n               tableName = be_users\n               columns {\n                   allowed_languages.mapOnProperty = allowedLanguages\n                   file_mountpoints.mapOnProperty = fileMountPoints\n                   db_mountpoints.mapOnProperty = dbMountPoints\n                   usergroup.mapOnProperty = backendUserGroups\n               }\n           }\n       }\n       TYPO3\CMS\Beuser\Domain\Model\BackendUserGroup {\n           mapping {\n               tableName = be_groups\n               columns {\n                   subgroup.mapOnProperty = subGroups\n               }\n           }\n       }\n   }"
```

TITLE: Configuring cUrl Certificate Path in PHP

The instruction requires setting the 'curl.cainfo' in the php.ini file to point to the downloaded cacert.pem file.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl.cainfo=PATH/To/your/cacert.pem
```

TITLE: Incorrect FlexForm File Path Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the correct and incorrect ways to add a FlexForm file to a content element in TYPO3. The first example shows the incorrect way where the `FILE:` prefix is missing, leading to an error. The second example shows the correct way, including the `FILE:` prefix, which is necessary for TYPO3 to properly locate and load the FlexForm file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1480765571.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
    "/**
     * WRONG WAY to add a FlexForm file to a content element
     */
    \TYPO3\CMS\Core\Utility\ExtensionManagementUtility::addPiFlexFormValue(
        '*',
        'EXT:my_extension/Resources/Private/FlexForm/MyFlexForm.xml',
        'textpic'
    );

    /**
     * CORRECT WAY to add a FlexForm file to a content element
     */
    \TYPO3\CMS\Core\Utility\ExtensionManagementUtility::addPiFlexFormValue(
        '*',
        'FILE:EXT:my_extension/Resources/Private/FlexForm/MyFlexForm.xml',
        'textpic'
    );"
```

TITLE: Configuring Extbase Plugin (Correct - Older TYPO3)
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates the correct configuration of an Extbase plugin in older TYPO3 versions. It includes the vendor name prefixed to the extension key. This snippet clarifies how to properly configure plugins for older TYPO3 versions when namespaces are in use.

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
// Correct in older TYPO3 versions:
TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Utility\ExtensionUtility::configurePlugin(
    'MyVendorName.' . $_EXTKEY,
    'Plugin',
    array('Controller' => 'action')
);
```

TITLE: Configuring supported options in a TYPO3 validator class
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to properly configure the $supportedOptions property in a StringLengthValidator class to avoid the exception. The configuration defines minimum and maximum options with their default values, descriptions, and types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1379981890.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
class StringLengthValidator extends AbstractValidator {
/**
 * @var array
 */
 protected $supportedOptions = [
    'minimum' => [0, 'minimum length for a valid string', 'integer'],
    'maximum' => [php_int_max, 'maximum length for a valid string', 'integer']
 ];
```

UPDATE sys_redirect SET target='t3://page?uid=1004' WHERE target='t3://page=uid=p1004';
```

TITLE: Configuring Extbase Plugin (Correct - Newer TYPO3)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the correct way to configure an Extbase plugin in newer TYPO3 versions using class name constants. It demonstrates how to configure plugins using fully qualified class names, which is the recommended approach for newer TYPO3 versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1289386765.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
// Correct in newer TYPO3 versions:
TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Utility\ExtensionUtility::configurePlugin(
    'MyExtension',
    'Plugin',
    [\MyVendor\MyExtensionName\Controlle\MyPluginController::class => 'action']
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Write Permissions for LocalConfiguration.php in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to check and set proper write permissions for the LocalConfiguration.php file in TYPO3. Shows the correct file permissions and the chmod command to grant group write access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1346323822.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
-rw-rw-r-- LocalConfiguration.php
chmod g+w LocalConfiguration.php
```

TITLE: Querying 1:1 Relations in TYPO3 Extbase
DESCRIPTION: This snippet highlights the correct way to query 1:1 relations in TYPO3 Extbase. It emphasizes using equals() instead of contains() for 1:1 relations to avoid expecting a 1:n or n:m relation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1327065745.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
$query->equals()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Activating cUrl Support in TYPO3 Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Enables cUrl support in TYPO3's Install-Tool environment by modifying the system settings. This is critical for avoiding connectivity issues post-installation. The only parameter required is [SYS][curlUse] which when set to 1 activates cUrl support.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1342635425.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: none
CODE:
```
[SYS][curlUse] = 1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Template Paths in TypoScript for TYPO3 13.4.0
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to properly configure template, partial, and layout root paths in TypoScript to resolve the Fluid template loading error.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1225709595.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: TypoScript
CODE:
```
page = PAGE
page {
 10 = FLUIDTEMPLATE
 10 {
    templateName = Default
    templateRootPaths.10 = EXT:site_package/Resources/Private/Templates/Pages/
+   partialRootPaths.10 = EXT:site_package/Resources/Private/Partials/Pages/
+   layoutRootPaths.10 = EXT:site_package/Resources/Private/Layouts/Pages/
  }
}
```

TITLE: Persisting Domain Objects in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to obtain an instance of the PersistenceManager in TYPO3 and use it to persist all changes. This is required when adding newly created domain objects to a repository and ensures that the UID is set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1260881688.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
   $persistenceManager = $this->objectManager->get('TYPO3\\CMS\\Extbase\\Persistence\\Generic\\PersistenceManager')

and persist it by hand with `$persistenceManager->persistAll()`.
```

TITLE: Registering Fluid Namespace in TYPO3 Template
DESCRIPTION: Example of wrapping a Fluid template with a div that registers the Fluid namespace to prevent PHPStorm from adding invalid xmlns attributes.

LANGUAGE: HTML
CODE:
```
<div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" lang="en"
     xmlns:f="https://typo3.org/ns/fluid/ViewHelpers"
>

    <!-- Fluid goes here -->

</div>
```

TITLE: Including Extbase TypoScript Setup in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to manually include the Extbase TypoScript setup file when setting a root template flag is not an option. This can resolve the 'No suitable request handler found' exception.

TITLE: Creating Links with Custom Format using TYPO3 Fluid
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create links using Typo3 Fluid where a custom URI variable named "format" is passed to an Extbase action. As "format" is a reserved keyword in TYPO3, it's recommended to rename it to avoid conflicts with rendering formats such as HTML or JSON. This helps in preventing template resolution errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1257246929.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<f:uri.action action=\"new\" arguments=\"{format: someFormat}\" />
<f:uri.action action=\"new\" format=\"{someFormat}\" />
```

TITLE: Invalid Plugin Configuration in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates an invalid usage of the method 'configurePlugin' from the TYPO3 Extbase Utility. The third parameter is incorrectly defined as an array of actions, which leads to the exception being thrown. This serves as a warning for developers to validate their configurations to prevent runtime issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1295479651.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
".. container::\n\n   ::\n\n      \\TYPO3\\CMS\\Extbase\\Utility\\ExtensionUtility::configurePlugin(\n          'Ext',\n          'Foo',\n          [FooController::class => ['show']],\n          []\n      );"
```

TITLE: Adding Plugin via TypoScript
DESCRIPTION: This TypoScript snippet demonstrates adding a plugin using Extbase bootstrap. It emphasizes setting the extensionName and vendorName using uppercase camel case to prevent configuration errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1316104317.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
lib.test = USER_INT
lib.test {
  userFunc = TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Core\Bootstrap->run
  extensionName = YourExt
  vendorName = YourVendor
  pluginName = Pi1
}
```

TITLE: Corrected Conditional TypoScript Assignment

TITLE: TYPO3 Exception Message
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet represents the TYPO3 exception message that is displayed when the nesting of select and group elements occurs in flex form sections with MM relations. The error message indicates the invalid flex form data structure and the specific element and section container where the nesting is happening. This message aids in debugging and identifying the source of the error in the TYPO3 configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1481647089.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
"#1481647089: Invalid flex form data structure on field name \"pi_flexform\"\n   with element \"foo\" in section container \"content\": Nesting select and group\n   elements in flex form sections is not allowed with MM relations."
```

TITLE: Fixing TYPO3 Cache Compression Setting in PHP
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet outlines the correct configuration for cache compression in TYPO3. Ensure that the TYPO3 core cache backend is properly set up with appropriate options to avoid exceptions.

TITLE: Configuring fluidContent in TypoScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure `lib.fluidContent` in TypoScript to override default template paths and add a list entry for a custom plugin. This is necessary when changing `templateRootPaths` in `fluid_styled_content` to ensure the correct templates, layouts, and partials are used. Adjusting `templateName`, `templateRootPaths`, `layoutRootPaths`, `partialRootPaths`, and adding a `list` entry are key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1253191023.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
lib.fluidContent {
    templateName = YourTemplateName
    templateRootPaths {
        30 = EXT:myext/Resources/Private/Templates
    }
    layoutRootPaths {
        30 = EXT:myext/Resources/Private/Layouts
    }
    partialRootPaths {
        30 = EXT:myext/Resources/Private/Partials
    }
    list {
        templateName = YourListTemplateName
    }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring PATHS_FULL_QUALIFIED_NAMESPACES for TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: This PHP snippet illustrates how to configure TYPO3 to exclude certain model paths when running Rector on TYPO3 v8 and below. This setup is required for ensuring that the code analysis tool runs properly without errors related to namespace declarations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1264093642.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
    $parameters->set(Typo3Option::PATHS_FULL_QUALIFIED_NAMESPACES, [
        // If you are targeting TYPO3 Version 11 use can now use Short namespace
        // @see namespace https://docs.typo3.org/m/typo3/reference-coreapi/main/en-us/ExtensionArchitecture/BestPractises/ConfigurationFiles.html
        'ext_localconf.php',
        'ext_tables.php',
        'ClassAliasMap.php',
        __DIR__ . '/**/Domain/Model/*',
        __DIR__ . '/**/Configuration/*.php',
        __DIR__ . '/**/Configuration/**/*.php',
    ]);
```

TITLE: Configuring FLUIDTEMPLATE in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure a FLUIDTEMPLATE in TYPO3. It specifies the main template file and sets paths for partials and layouts. Additionally, it includes variable assignments necessary for rendering content on the specified column position.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1288085266.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
page.10 = FLUIDTEMPLATE
   page.10 {
     # this line is important!
     file = fileadmin/templates/file.html
     # Set the Template Pathes
     partialRootPath = fileadmin/templates/partials/
     layoutRootPath = fileadmin/templates/layouts/
     variables {
       # Assign the main column with our {content}-destination
       content < styles.content.get
       content.select.where = colPos = 1
     }
   }
```

TITLE: Initializing Object (Incorrect)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates the incorrect way of initializing the query settings, which can lead to the "Missing storage page ids" exception. It uses a generic `TYPO3QuerySettings` object, which does not inherit the plugin context and pid settings from FlexForm or TypoScript. This is problematic when `$querySettings->setIgnoreEnableFields(true)` is used.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1365779762.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
      public function initializeObject()
      {
          /** @var \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Persistence\Generic\TYPO3QuerySettings $querySettings */
          $querySettings = $this->objectManager->get(\TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Persistence\Generic\TYPO3QuerySettings::class);
          $querySettings->setIgnoreEnableFields(true);
          $querySettings->setEnableFieldsToBeIgnored(['fe_group']);
          $this->setDefaultQuerySettings($querySettings);
      }
```

TITLE: Handling TCA Configuration Errors in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: This PHP snippet highlights a common issue in TYPO3 when using a 'displayCond' key in TCA definitions for non-page records. This configuration can cause errors if applied inappropriately. The snippet shows the use of 'PseudoSiteTcaDisplayCondition' class, which should be limited to pages. The issue arises in tt_address versions 5.0.0 to 5.2.0, particularly with the 'slug' field. Prerequisites include understanding TYPO3 TCA configurations and ensuring appropriate context application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1534710048.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```

   . \\TYPO3\CMS\Core\Compatibility\PseudoSiteTcaDisplayCondition::class .
   '->isInPseudoSite:pages:false'
```

TITLE: Creating Menu Items in TYPO3 Backend Module
DESCRIPTION: This PHP code demonstrates how to add a menu item to the menu in a custom TYPO3 backend module. The exception occurs when the title or href of the menu item is empty, often due to the UriBuilder returning an empty result.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1442236317.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
$menu = $moduleTemplate->getDocHeaderComponent()->getMenuRegistry()->makeMenu();

$menuItem = $menu->makeMenuItem()
   ->setTitle($menuItemConfig['label'])
   ->setHref($this->uriBuilder->reset()->uriFor($menuItemConfig['action'], [], $menuItemConfig['controller']))
   ->setActive($isActive);
$menu->addMenuItem($menuItem);
```

TITLE: Doctrine Query Builder Code Before Fix
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates the incorrect way of adding WHERE constraints using an array without unpacking.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1476107295.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
"$constraints = [];
    $constraints[] = $queryBuilder->expr()->eq('doktype', 100);
    $constraints[] = $queryBuilder->expr()->in('categories.uid_local', $categories);

    $result = $queryBuilder->select('pages.*')
        ->from('pages')
        ->where($constraints)
        ->execute()
        ->fetchAllAssociative();"
```

TITLE: Defining CONTENT without Further Definition in TypoScript

Proper care should be taken to ensure that any defined CONTENT elements are correctly configured to avoid such errors.

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:

   temp.item = CONTENT
   [globalVar = LIT:1 = {$constant}]
   temp.item {
   }
   [global]
```

TITLE: Configuring PHP Settings for TYPO3 Exception Handling
DESCRIPTION: This snippet suggests modifying the PHP configuration to address issues related to retrieving extension hash files in TYPO3. By enabling 'allow_url_fopen' and setting an appropriate 'max_execution_time', the system can better handle long-running operations when accessing remote servers. These settings should be adjusted in the php.ini or vhost configuration file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1342635016.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
allow_url_fopen = On
max_execution_time = 300
```

TITLE: TYPO3 Wrong Slot Method Example

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
   class DatabaseRecordListSlots
   {
     public function addValuesToCsvRow($csvRow)
     {
       $csvRow['new'] = 128;
       return $csvRow;
     }
   }
```

TITLE: SQL Query Missing Table
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query demonstrates a common cause of TYPO3 exception 1247602160: a missing database table. This usually indicates that the model hasn't been mapped to a database table via TypoScript. The query attempts to select data from a non-existent table.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1247602160.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
"    --#1247602160: Table 'my_database.tx_extendpages_domain_model_page' doesn't exist:\n    SELECT tx_extendpages_domain_model_page.* FROM tx_extendpages_domain_model_page\n    WHERE tx_extendpages_domain_model_page.uid = '56' LIMIT 1"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fixing form.select ViewHelper with Special Characters
DESCRIPTION: This error occurs when using special characters like 'ß', 'ä', 'ö', 'ü' in option keys of form.select ViewHelper. The solution is to replace these special characters with their ASCII equivalents.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1237900529.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: markup
CODE:
```
  <f:form.select options="{
                            1: 'Bauhauptgewerbe',
                               Straßenbauer: '- Straßenbauer'}"/>
```

LANGUAGE: markup
CODE:
```
  <f:form.select options="{
                            1: 'Bauhauptgewerbe',
                               Strassenbauer: '- Straßenbauer'}"/>
```

TITLE: Running Shell Commands to Manage Exception Codes
DESCRIPTION: This shell script demonstrates various commands for managing TYPO3 exception codes. It includes installing dependencies, updating missing exception codes, and generating documentation pages. The script can also make git commits automatically when specified. Dependencies include Docker and a compatible PHP version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/README.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Install application dependencies:
$ Build/Scripts/runTests.sh -s composerInstall
# or
$ composer install --working-dir=./Build/app

# Create exception code collections for new release tags only
$ Build/Scripts/runTests.sh -s updateExceptionCodesMissingTags
# or
$ php Build/app/console.php exception-codes:fetch

# Create exception code collections for new release tags only and
# and create a git commit:
$ Build/Scripts/runTests.sh -s updateExceptionCodesMissingTags -c
# or
$ php Build/app/console.php exception-codes:fetch --auto-commit

# Create missing exception code pages
$ Build/Scripts/runTests.sh -s createMissingExceptionCodeFiles
# or
$ php Build/app/console.php exception-codes:generate-pages

# Create missing exception code pages and create a commit
$ Build/Scripts/runTests.sh -s createMissingExceptionCodeFiles -c
# or
$ php Build/app/console.php exception-codes:generate-pages --auto-commit

# List all available commands aka testsuits (-s) and options
$ Build/Scripts/runTests.sh -h
```

TITLE: Troubleshooting TypoScript Configuration in TYPO3 CMS
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a step-by-step checklist for users to verify their TypoScript template settings in TYPO3 CMS to resolve the ServiceUnavailable error. It emphasizes the importance of proper template configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1294587218.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
.. include:: /Includes.rst.txt

==========================
TYPO3 Exception 1294587218
==========================

.. include:: /If-you-encounter-this-exception.rst.txt

ServiceUnavailable: TypoScriptFrontendController
================================================

TypoScript is the language, in which the internal object structure in
TYPO3 CMS is described (not the HTML DOM). Each page needs at least one
TypoScript template either in its own properties or in an upward page.

So you need at least one page and a "root level" template record with
some content.

If you have both, go through the following:

First, check wether the page you don't see or at least one of the pages
in root-direction has a TypoScript template which works, is active and
has root-level property. To achieve this, go to the following window:

:guilabel:`Template` Module in the left column > :guilabel:`page` is selected in middle column
> :guilabel:`info/edit` in top selection field > :guilabel:`edit complete template record` >
"General" - tab

-  check the template TypoScript code in the "Setup" - text field
-  The "inactive" field must be unchecked.
-  Check, whether root-level property is set in the "Options" tab: the
   "root level" field must be checked.

If all this is o.k., but the error occurs nonetheless, you may delete
and re-create the root template.

Delete the root template with the little trash bin on top of template
edit page.

Then create a new template by clicking "Create template for new
website". This button has appeared after deleting the root template.

Additionally, you find many information in the docs on TYPO3.org

-  https://docs.typo3.org

SOLUTION 1 (Tested with TYPO3 7+)
=================================

#. In the backend, click on 'Template' menu under web module.
#. Click on the main page (usually id 1)
#. Select *Info/Modify* in the dropdown menu on the header section of
   the content pane.
#. Click on the *Edit the whole template record* button.
#. Click on the *Options* tab.
#. Make sure to select *Rootlevel* checkbox. Problem solved.
```

TITLE: Conditional CONTENT Assignment in TypoScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a less problematic approach to defining a CONTENT object in TYPO3 TypoScript by conditionally assigning the CONTENT element. This method is more robust and reduces the risk of encountering the missing TCA exception, ensuring better error handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1283790586.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
.. code-block:: typoscript

   temp.item =
   [globalVar = LIT:1 = {$constant}]
   temp.item = CONTENT
   temp.item {
   }
   [global]
```

TITLE: Defining Display Conditions with AND Clause in XML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to set up a display condition in a TYPO3 FlexForm XML using the <AND> clause. It demonstrates how to align subtitles based on certain conditions. The main dependency is TYPO3 CMS, and the key parameter is the display condition that checks if the subtitle setting is not equal to zero. If only one condition is needed, using <AND> is discouraged to prevent exceptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1481464101.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<settings.subtitle_align>
        <TCEforms>
            <label>Subtitle Alignment</label>
              <displayCond>
                <AND>
                  FIELD:settings.subtitle:!=:0
                </AND>
              </displayCond>
          <!-- ....... -->
   </settings.subtitle_align>
```

DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set a custom TypeConverter for a property in TYPO3 CMS. It demonstrates the correct way to instantiate and set the TypeConverter object.

LANGUAGE: php

```
public function isValidEntryIdentifier($identifier) {
    return preg_match(self::PATTERN_ENTRYIDENTIFIER, $identifier) === 1;
}

TITLE: Processing Request with Exception Handling in TYPO3 8.7 PHP
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to handle a scenario in TYPO3 8.7 where a request to a single view action cannot find an object due to it being hidden or deleted. The code checks for a specific exception and responds accordingly, ensuring the user is informed of the missing object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1297933823.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
/**
       * @param \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Mvc\RequestInterface $request
       * @param \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Mvc\ResponseInterface $response
       * @throws \Exception|\TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Property\Exception
       */
      public function processRequest(\TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Mvc\RequestInterface $request, \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Mvc\ResponseInterface $response)
      {
          try {
              parent::processRequest($request, $response);
          }
          catch(\TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Property\Exception\TargetNotFoundException $e) {
              if ($e instanceof \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Property\Exception\TargetNotFoundException) {
                  $GLOBALS['TSFE']->pageNotFoundAndExit('The given id could not be mapped to an object.');
              } else {
                  throw $e;
              }
          }
      }
```

TITLE: Handling RuntimeException for Missing Getter Method in TYPO3 Model - PHP
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows another occurrence of a RuntimeException for a different property 'startdate' in a TYPO3 model. It stresses the importance of having a nullable return type for the getter method to resolve the error.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1546632293.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
// Situation
// When validating a controller's argument, the following exception is thrown:

#1546632293 RuntimeException Could not get value of property "Site\Site\Domain\Model\Booking::startdate",
make sure the property is either public or has a getter getStartdate(), a hasser hasStartdate() or an isser isStartdate().

// Solution
// In the getter, the return value has to be nullable:
public function getStartdate(): ?DateTime;
```

TITLE: Defining ImportDataControl Node in TYPO3 PHP
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a class 'ImportDataControl' that extends 'AbstractNode'. The render method constructs an array for node representation, including an icon identifier, title fetched from language files, link attributes, and required JS modules. It is crucial for defining node behavior in TYPO3 CMS and relies on TYPO3's language management.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1483890482.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
class ImportDataControl extends AbstractNode
{
    public function render()
    {
        $result = [
            'iconIdentifier' => 'import-data',
            'title' => $GLOBALS['LANG']->sL('LLL:EXT:examples/Resources/Private/Language/locallang_db.xlf:pages.importData'),
            'linkAttributes' => [
                'class' => 'importData ',
                'data-id' => $this->data['databaseRow']['somefield']
            ],
            'requireJsModules' => ['TYPO3/CMS/Examples/ImportData'],
        ];
        return $result;
    }
}

```

TITLE: Disabling TYPO3 Maintenance Mode Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides the configuration setting required to disable TYPO3 maintenance mode, allowing non-admin users to access the installation. Ensure you have administrator access to modify this setting via the Install Tool.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1294585860.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
[BE][adminOnly] = 0
```

   ---------

   issue occurring.

   issue.

TITLE: TypoScript Configuration for Fluidpages
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure TypoScript when using Fluidpages.  It is necessary to add the vendorName. This TypoScript is required when namespaces were implemented in fluidpages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1289386765.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
5 = USER
5.userFunc = TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Core\Bootstrap->run
5.extensionName = Fluidpages
### the following line is new and required:
5.vendorName = FluidTYPO3
5.pluginName = Page
```

TITLE: Validating composer.json syntax using Composer CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command to validate the syntax of a composer.json file using the Composer command line tool. This helps identify syntax errors and their line numbers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1439555561.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer.phar validate
```

TITLE: TypoScript Configuration for Plugin
DESCRIPTION: This TypoScript snippet demonstrates how to configure a plugin within the TypoScript setup. It defines the `controller.action` property for the plugin, allowing you to specify which controller and action to use for rendering the plugin's output. This configuration is crucial for defining the plugin's behavior and functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1540246570.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
    "plugin.tx_myextension {
        controller.action = EXTBASEPLUGIN
    }"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Declaring ViewHelper Namespace in TYPO3 Fluid Template
DESCRIPTION: Examples of how to declare namespaces for ViewHelpers in TYPO3 Fluid templates. This is crucial for resolving namespace-related exceptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1224254792.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: fluid
CODE:
```
{namespace myNamespace=Tx_MyExt_ViewHelpers}
```

LANGUAGE: fluid
CODE:
```
{namespace myNamespace=Vendor\MyExt\ViewHelpers}
```

LANGUAGE: fluid
CODE:
```
{namespace v=Tx_Vhs_ViewHelpers}
```

TITLE: TypoScript Include Static Info Tables Setup
DESCRIPTION: This TypoScript code includes the setup file for the `static_info_tables` extension. This ensures that the necessary TypoScript configurations are loaded, allowing the extension to function correctly. Including this file is often required to resolve issues related to missing tables or incorrect data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1247602160.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: typoscript
CODE:
```
"   <INCLUDE_TYPOSCRIPT: source=\"FILE:EXT:static_info_tables/Configuration/TypoScript/Extbase/setup.txt\">"
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1436717267.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_3

CODE:
```
..
   TYPO3 [version] - [date of report]
   ==================================

   ---------------------

   including its version number and any other information that
   you think will be relevant to other users who encounter the same issue.

   The Issue
   ---------

   Detail each of the steps or changes that took place leading up to the
   issue occurring.

   Solution
   --------

   Did you resolve the issue? List the steps or changes made that resolved the
   issue.
```

TITLE: Defining Display Conditions without AND Clause in XML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the correct way to set up a display condition in a TYPO3 FlexForm XML without using the <AND> clause, which is necessary when there is only a single condition. It prevents the associated exception from occurring when the subtitle setting is verified.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1481464101.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<settings.subtitle_align>
        <TCEforms>
            <label>Subtitle Alignment</label>
              <displayCond>
                  FIELD:settings.subtitle:!=:0
              </displayCond>
          <!-- ....... -->
   </settings.subtitle_align>
```

TITLE: Instantiating Extbase Repository in TYPO3 CMS
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the correct way to instantiate an Extbase repository using the object manager instead of GeneralUtility::makeInstance(). It's used within a controller action.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
class MyController extends \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Mvc\Controller\ActionController
{
    public function fooAction()
    {
        $repo = $this->objectManager->get(MyRepository::class);
        $item = $repo->findByUid(1);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Retrieving String Argument from Request Object in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to manually check for and retrieve a string argument from the request object in a TYPO3 controller action. It shows how to handle cases where TYPO3's built-in GET/POST to action parameter mapping does not support strings, necessitating manual retrieval.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1253175643.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
if ($this->request->hasArgument('parameter')) {

    $keyword = $this->request->getArgument('parameter');

}
```

TITLE: TYPO3 Signal Slot Dispatcher Exception Code
DESCRIPTION: Shows the implementation of the Signal Slot Dispatcher that throws the exception when encountering an unregistered class. The code checks if a class is registered with the object manager before attempting to instantiate it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1245673367.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
throw new Tx_Extbase_SignalSlot_Exception_InvalidSlotException(sprintf('Cannot dispatch %s::%s to class %s. The object manager is not yet available in the Signal Slot Dispatcher and therefore it cannot dispatch classes.', $signalClassName, $signalName, $slotInformation['class']), 1298113624);
    }
    if (!$this->objectManager->isRegistered($slotInformation['class'])) {
        throw new Tx_Extbase_SignalSlot_Exception_InvalidSlotException('The given class "' . $slotInformation['class'] . '" is not a registered object.', 1245673367);
    }
    $object = $this->objectManager->get($slotInformation['class']);
}
```

TITLE: Outdated Database Configuration in TYPO3
DESCRIPTION: Example of outdated database configuration in AdditionalConf.php that caused the redirect loop error after upgrading TYPO3 to version 8.7. This uses the deprecated ConfigurationManager::setLocalConfigurationValueByPath method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1380581244.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
\TYPO3\CMS\Core\Configuration\ConfigurationManager::setLocalConfigurationValueByPath('DB/database', 'DBNAME');
\TYPO3\CMS\Core\Configuration\ConfigurationManager::setLocalConfigurationValueByPath('DB/username', 'USERNAME');
\TYPO3\CMS\Core\Configuration\ConfigurationManager::setLocalConfigurationValueByPath('DB/password', 'PASSWORD');
```

TITLE: Querying sys_file_reference table in SQL
DESCRIPTION: This SQL query attempts to select all columns from the `sys_file_reference` table where the `uid` is 1 and the `deleted` flag is 0. The purpose is to check if a specific file reference exists and is not marked as deleted. The query is executed to diagnose a bug in TYPO3 6.2.15 that leads to the exception.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1317178794.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
SELECT * FROM sys_file_reference WHERE uid=1 AND sys_file_reference.deleted=0
```

TITLE: Incorrect Property Definition in TYPO3 Extbase Model
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows an incorrect way of defining properties in a TYPO3 Extbase model, which leads to the Exception 1476045117. It uses separate use statements and a shortened ObjectStorage declaration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1476045117.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:

TITLE: Adding Model Annotations with Extension Builder in TYPO3 PHP
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to correct missing dependency injections in models when modifying extensions with TYPO3 Extension Builder. Ensure all sections specify the new model path correctly, e.g., \TYPO3\CMS\Extbase\Persistence\ObjectStorage<\{VendorName}\{Ext}\Domain\Model\{NewModel}>. Clear TYPO3 caches, delete temporary files, and truncate cache tables to finalize changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1251315967.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: PHP
CODE:
```
/**
 * Adds a {newModel}
 *
 * @param ${newModel}
 * @return void
 */

  Change to

 /**
 * Adds a {newModel}
  *
 * @param \{VendorName}\{Ext}\Domain\Model\{NewModel} ${newModel}
 * @return void
 */
```

TITLE: SQL Table Definition with Duplicate Column
DESCRIPTION: Example of an invalid SQL table definition in a TYPO3 extension with repeated 'tstamp' column, which can trigger Exception 40
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/40.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
CREATE TABLE sys_products_fe_users_mm_visited_products (
    uid int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
    pid int(11) DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,
    tstamp int(11) DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,
    crdate int(11) DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,
    deleted tinyint(4) DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,
    hidden tinyint(4) DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,
    tstamp int(11) unsigned DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,
    uid_local int(11) DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,
    uid_foreign int(11) DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,
    qty int(11) unsigned DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,

    PRIMARY KEY (uid),
    KEY uid_local (uid_local),
    KEY uid_foreign (uid_foreign),
);
```

TITLE: Fixing Type Mismatch in Fluid TranslateViewHelper
DESCRIPTION: This error occurs when the TranslateViewHelper receives a string instead of an array for the 'arguments' parameter. The solution is to properly format arguments as an array.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1237900529.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markup
CODE:
```
#1237900529: The argument "arguments" was registered with type "array", but is of type "string" in view helper "Tx_Fluid_ViewHelpers_TranslateViewHelper"
```

LANGUAGE: markup
CODE:
```
<f:for each="{newsItem.author}" as="currentAuthor">
<f:translate key="author" arguments="{currentAuthor.name}" />
</f:for>
```

LANGUAGE: markup
CODE:
```
<f:for each="{newsItem.author}" as="currentAuthor">
<f:translate key="author" arguments="{0: currentAuthor.name}" />
</f:for>
```

'pages' => [

    'options' => [
        'compression' => 1,
    ],
],
```

   The Issue
   ---------

   issue occurring.

   issue.
```

DESCRIPTION: An example of the error message shown when a Fluid template contains a closing tag without a matching opening tag. The error provides the specific location of the problem in the template file.

CODE:
```
#1224485838 TYPO3Fluid\Fluid\Core\Parser\Exception
Fluid parse error in template ..., line ... at character .... Error: You closed a templating tag which you never opened! (error code 1224485838). Template source chunk: </f:sometag>
```

```

        return('');
}

TITLE: 404 error handler - Error Message
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the error message when the 404 error handler is set to display content from a page, but cURL fails to fetch the page due to SSL certificate issues on a development domain. The error includes details about the cURL error and the target host name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1544172838.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
"(1/1) #1544172838 Error handler could not fetch error pageuntimeException\n    Error handler could not fetch error page\n    \"https://project.localdomain.vm/http-error-404\",\n    reason: cURL error 51: SSL: no alternative certificate subject name\n    matches target host name 'project.localdomain.vm' (see\n    https://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/libcurl-errors.html)"
```

TITLE: Handling Page Not Found in TYPO3 9.5 PHP
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to handle the case of a missing object in TYPO3 9.5 by utilizing the `ErrorController` to provide a user-friendly response when an object cannot be found. It replaces the deprecated method used in previous TYPO3 versions with a more updated approach.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1297933823.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
return GeneralUtility::makeInstance(ErrorController::class)->pageNotFoundAction(
        $this->request,
        'The requested page does not exist',
        ['code' => PageAccessFailureReasons::PAGE_NOT_FOUND]
      );
```

TITLE: Handling Unsupported Task Types in LocalImageProcessor - plaintext
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the restrictions of the LocalImageProcessor in TYPO3, specifying that it can only handle tasks of type 'Image' named 'Preview' or 'CropScaleMask'. Any other combination will raise an exception, specifically TYPO3 Exception 1350570621.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1350570621.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
The `LocalImageProcessor` can currently handle tasks of type `Image` named
`Preview` or `CropScaleMask` - all other task type/name combinations will produce
this error.
```

TITLE: Displaying TYPO3 Exception 1241722579 Error Message
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the error message for TYPO3 Exception 1241722579. The error occurs when the DateTime constructor fails to parse a time string, specifically when it encounters an unexpected character '@' at the beginning of the string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1241722579.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
(1/1) #1241722579 TYPO3Fluid\Fluid\Core\ViewHelper\Exception

"@" could not be parsed by \DateTime constructor:
DateTime::__construct(): Failed to parse time string (@) at position 0
(@): Unexpected character
```

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
.. include:: /Includes.rst.txt

==========================
TYPO3 Exception 1353401835
==========================

.. include:: /If-you-encounter-this-exception.rst.txt


..
   TYPO3 [version] - [date of report]
   ==================================

   Installation Overview
   ---------------------

   Provide as much information about your installation of TYPO3
   including its version number and any other information that
   you think will be relevant to other users who encounter the same issue.

   The Issue
   ---------

   Detail each of the steps or changes that took place leading up to the
   issue occurring.

   Solution
   --------

   Did you resolve the issue? List the steps or changes made that resolved the
   issue.
```

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
.. include:: /Includes.rst.txt

==========================
TYPO3 Exception 1395140007
==========================

.. include:: /If-you-encounter-this-exception.rst.txt


..
   [TYPO3 version] - [Date of solution]
   ====================================

   Situation
   ---------

   Describe everything to understand the situation: Systems, environment, versions.
   What happened?

   Solution
   --------

   issue occurring.

   issue.
```

   including its version number and any other information that
   you think will be relevant to other users who encounter the same issue.

   The Issue
   ---------

   Detail each of the steps or changes that took place leading up to the
   issue occurring.

   --------

   Did you resolve the issue? List the steps or changes made that resolved the
   issue.
```

TITLE: RST Comment Block with Template Structure for Exception Documentation
DESCRIPTION: An RST comment block containing a template structure for documenting TYPO3 exceptions, including sections for installation details, issue description, and solution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1436717302.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
..
   TYPO3 [version] - [date of report]
   ==================================

   Installation Overview
   ---------------------

   Provide as much information about your installation of TYPO3
   including its version number and any other information that
   you think will be relevant to other users who encounter the same issue.

   The Issue
   ---------

   Detail each of the steps or changes that took place leading up to the
   issue occurring.

   Solution
   --------

   Did you resolve the issue? List the steps or changes made that resolved the
   issue.
```

TITLE: Including TYPO3 Exception Documentation Template in RST
DESCRIPTION: This RST code snippet includes a template for documenting TYPO3 exceptions. It provides sections for version information, installation overview, issue details, and solution steps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1425990190.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
.. include:: /Includes.rst.txt

==========================
TYPO3 Exception 1425990190
==========================

.. include:: /If-you-encounter-this-exception.rst.txt


..
   TYPO3 [version] - [date of report]
   ==================================

   Installation Overview
   ---------------------

   Provide as much information about your installation of TYPO3
   including its version number and any other information that
   you think will be relevant to other users who encounter the same issue.

   The Issue
   ---------

   Detail each of the steps or changes that took place leading up to the
   issue occurring.

   Solution
   --------

   Did you resolve the issue? List the steps or changes made that resolved the
   issue.
```

TITLE: Defining Document Structure in reStructuredText Comments
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the structure of the document using reStructuredText comments. It provides a template for documenting TYPO3 exceptions, including sections for version, installation overview, issue description, and solution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/TYPO3-Documentation/TYPO3CMS-Exceptions/blob/main/Documentation/Exceptions/1681390133.rst#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: reStructuredText
CODE:
```
..
   TYPO3 [version] - [date of report]
   ==================================

   Installation Overview
   ---------------------

   Provide as much information about your installation of TYPO3
   including its version number and any other information that
   you think will be relevant to other users who encounter the same issue.

   The Issue
   ---------

   Detail each of the steps or changes that took place leading up to the
   issue occurring.

   Solution
   --------

   Did you resolve the issue? List the steps or changes made that resolved the
   issue.
```

TITLE: RST Documentation Template Comments
DESCRIPTION: Comment block containing the template structure for documenting TYPO3 exceptions, including sections for version information, installation overview, issue details, and solution steps.

CODE:

   TYPO3 [version] - [date of report]
   ==================================

   Installation Overview
   ---------------------

   Provide as much information about your installation of TYPO3
   including its version number and any other information that
   you think will be relevant to other users who encounter the same issue.

   The Issue
   ---------

   Detail each of the steps or changes that took place leading up to the
   issue occurring.

   Solution
   --------

   Did you resolve the issue? List the steps or changes made that resolved the
   issue.
```
